meanings.definition: To force upon or impose fraudulently or unjustifiably
meanings.sent1: The salesman tried to foist the fake watch on me.
meanings.sent2: She always foists her opinions on others without considering their feelings.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to foist a rubber chicken as a real one, but everyone knew it was fake.
meanings.sent4: The con artist foisted his fake paintings on unsuspecting buyers.
meanings.sent5: The bully would often foist his chores onto his younger brother.

meanings.definition: To pass off as genuine or valuable
meanings.sent1: He tried to foist the counterfeit money at the store.
meanings.sent2: The scammer foisted the fake gemstone as a rare diamond.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to foist his poorly written essay as a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: She foisted her old phone as a brand new one to her friend.
meanings.sent5: The art forger foisted his paintings as original masterpieces.

meanings.definition: To insert or introduce surreptitiously or without warrant
meanings.sent1: The spy managed to foist the secret documents out of the building.
meanings.sent2: She foisted her name onto the list without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent3: The prankster tried to foist a whoopee cushion on the teacher's chair.
meanings.sent4: The hacker foisted a virus into the company's computer system.
meanings.sent5: The cat burglar foisted the stolen necklace into the unsuspecting tourist's bag.
